title: Alkylsilyl-substituted benzodithiophene-based small molecules as promising hole-transport materials for perovskite solar cells
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,2437-2445
DOI: 10.1039/D3SE01617J, Communication
M. E. Sideltsev, A. N. Zhivchikova, I. E. Kuznetsov, D. K. Sagdullina, M. M. Tepliakova, A. A. Piryazev, D. V. Anokhin, M. S. Maksimovich, N. G. Nikitenko, D. A. Ivanov, A. V. Akkuratov
The PSCs with newly designed TB-Si3-3 delivered high power conversion efficiency of 16.8% and good operational stability featuring the great potential of alkylsilyl-substituted small molecules as dopant-free HTMs for perovskite photovoltaic applications.
